title: [BUG] `ARIMA`, `ThetaForecaster`, `AutoETS`: `predict_interval` & `predict_coverage` give counterintuitive results
body:
**Describe the bug**

Some of these may be bugs and some may just need clarification.

1. ARIMA `predict_interval` produces wider intervals for lower coverage level compared to the higher coverage level
2. Quantile to alpha conversion seems to be inconsistent.
3. AutoETS predictions do not match the 50% quantile from `predict_quantiles`
4. Coverage to quantile conversion seems to be inconsistent.

**To Reproduce**

The entire code can be found here: https://gist.github.com/ngupta23/ab7e003de06ae5b919937c31b2bad179 with snippets below

```python
from sktime.datasets import load_airline
from sktime.forecasting.arima import ARIMA
from sktime.forecasting.theta import ThetaForecaster
y = load_airline()
```

## ARIMA 
```python
forecaster = ARIMA(order=(1, 1, 0), seasonal_order=(0, 1, 0, 12))
forecaster.fit(y, fh=[1,2,3])

forecaster.predict(return_pred_int=True, alpha=0.05)
forecaster.predict_quantiles(alpha=[0.025, 0.05, 0.1, 0.5, 0.9, 0.95, 0.975])
forecaster.predict_interval(coverage=[0.8, 0.9, 0.95])
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33585645/159455224-202b4135-b20f-47ca-a8ac-88f4d1bbb018.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33585645/159455256-2121c932-25fa-4657-a38e-820191d97239.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33585645/159455279-3729d87e-9ada-45bd-a2aa-0ee8b3af6fc8.png)

### Observations

1. The 0.5 quantile from `predict_quantiles` matches with the forecast from `predict`. (Check pass)
2. ARIMA `predict_interval` produces wider intervals for lower coverage levels compared to the higher coverage level (Seems like a bug).
3. Intervals returned from `predict` with alpha = 0.05 seems to correspond to Quantiles = [0.025, 0.975] which is counter to this comment. Some clarification would be helpful) - https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2134#issuecomment-1049853020

> The "old" DEFAULT_ALPHA of 0.05 (alpha_low above) corresponds to a coverage of 0.9, and quantile points alpha_low = 0.05, alpha_high = 0.95.

4. Coverage of 0.9 does not match quantiles [0.05, 0.95]. Coverage of 0.95 does not match quantiles [0.025, 0.975]. (seems like a bug)

## Theta

```python
forecaster = ThetaForecaster(sp=12)
forecaster.fit(y, fh=[1,2,3])

forecaster.predict(fh=[1,2,3], return_pred_int=True, alpha=0.05)
forecaster.predict_quantiles(alpha=[0.025, 0.05, 0.1, 0.5, 0.9, 0.95, 0.975])
forecaster.predict_interval(coverage=[0.8, 0.9, 0.95])
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33585645/159455827-892200b8-1ff2-497b-88c2-f773715eacae.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33585645/159455848-abfa42ce-0c3c-4126-80ad-dd2e674a1893.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33585645/159455895-32a32aae-ca44-4673-9cb2-29766d39b010.png)


### Observations

1. The 0.5 quantile from `predict_quantiles` matches with the forecast from `predict`. (Check pass)
2. ThetaForecaster `predict_interval` produces narrower intervals for lower coverage levels compared to the higher coverage level (Check pass).
3. Intervals returned from `predict` with alpha = 0.05 do not seem to correspond to any of the expected quantile levels (seems like a bug in one of the methods)

> The "old" DEFAULT_ALPHA of 0.05 (alpha_low above) corresponds to a coverage of 0.9, and quantile points alpha_low = 0.05, alpha_high = 0.95.

4. Coverage of 0.9 matches quantiles [0.05, 0.95] (pass)



## AutoETS

```python
forecaster = AutoETS(auto=True, n_jobs=-1, sp=12)
forecaster.fit(y, fh=[1,2,3])

forecaster.predict(fh=[1,2,3], return_pred_int=True, alpha=0.05)
forecaster.predict_quantiles(alpha=[0.025, 0.05, 0.1, 0.5, 0.9, 0.95, 0.975])
forecaster.predict_interval(coverage=[0.8, 0.9, 0.95])
```
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33585645/159460483-84747439-bbc5-41d3-96b2-201ce21ac36b.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33585645/159460589-cc38001e-bdd5-4d53-b616-083ea3cb8ade.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33585645/159460690-5936a778-2b24-4507-9200-8c313eed2b25.png)

### Observations

1. The 0.5 quantile from `predict_quantiles` does not match with the forecast from `predict`. (Seems like a bug when compared to other models above)
2. AutoETS `predict_interval` produces narrower intervals for lower coverage levels compared to the higher coverage level (Check pass).
3. Intervals returned from `predict` with alpha = 0.05 do not seem to correspond to any of the expected quantile levels (seems like a bug in one of the methods)

> The "old" DEFAULT_ALPHA of 0.05 (alpha_low above) corresponds to a coverage of 0.9, and quantile points alpha_low = 0.05, alpha_high = 0.95.

4. Coverage of 0.9 does not match quantiles [0.05, 0.95]. Coverage of 0.95 does not match quantiles [0.025, 0.975].  (seems like a bug)

**Expected behavior**
Consistent behavior across the various forecasters.
